revised_title: The Rectal Complex Function in Lepidoptera Larvae
tldr: The article investigates the rectal complex in the larvae of Lepidoptera, focusing on Pieris brassicae and Manduca sexta. It explains how the rectal complex helps maintain salt balance under heavy dietary loading and contributes to the removal of water from the faeces. The rectal complex plays a significant role in the excretory system of these larvae, and the study provides insights into the mechanisms involved.
